result.execSummary:
The defendant Montgomery A. Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Montgomery A. Winters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Montgomery A. Winters was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
30 days to pay or 10 days KCJ with huber or 10 days on work crew.
Expunction hrg 9-9-16 @ 9:00 am

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montgomery A. Winters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft.  No action taken on expungment
Satisfaction of Commitment - Deft completed work crew in lieu of fine and costs
30 days to pay or 10 days KCJ with huber or 10 days on work crew.

Deft appeared back in court; he is unable to report to the work crew on 9/14/15 - he is going up north to work on a farm.  Court insteads institutes a fine of $50 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 10 days work crew or 10 days KCJ.  Work crew sentence is vacated.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Deft wishes to proceed w/o counsel.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 15 days work crew.  Deft to report to the work crew office on 9/14/15 @ 8am.  In default, 15 days KCJ.  Expunction hrg 9/9/16 @ 9am.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/James L B or his residence; Somers House Tavern
940.19(1) - Battery  /  947.01(1) - DC use of a dangerous weapon

117pm
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Law Student Ben Schwarz and supervised by Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk NJ.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  PTC on 8/14/15 @ 145pm.  FPT on 9/10/15 @ 1020am.  JS on 9/28/15 @ 900am.  $2500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  Ben Schwarz moves to disiss Count 2: Denied.   jk
and witness list filed by the State
